benchmark_details.name: Enhancing Video Captions Using Large Language Models
benchmark_details.overview: This research investigates the integration of Large Language Models (LLMs) to enhance the accuracy and context-awareness of captions generated by automatic speech recognition (ASR) systems for the Deaf and Hard of Hearing (DHH) community. A dataset is curated to evaluate the proposed pipeline's effectiveness in correcting ASR-generated captions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve the quality of video captions for the Deaf and Hard of Hearing community by leveraging Large Language Models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: LLMs might miss or misinterpret voice intonations, cultural references, and idioms that manual captioning can understand and convey accurately.

data.source: Dataset of 52 videos collected from YouTube representing diverse domains.
data.annotation: Manually generated ground truth captions for comparison with ASR-generated captions.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the comparison between LLM-generated captions and ground truth captions.
methodology.interpretation: A lower WER indicates better accuracy; BLEU and ROUGE assess precision and recall of generated captions.
methodology.validation: The performance of LLMs was evaluated against ground truth captions.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential misinterpretation of cultural references by LLMs.
